questions.question:
What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
int x = 5;
x = x++ + ++x;
printf("%d", x);
}

What will be the output of the following C code?

int main()
{
printf("Hello World! %d \n", x);
return 0;
}

options.b: Hello World! followed by a junk value

questions.question:
What will be the output of the following C code?

int main()
{
int y = 10000;
int y = 34;
printf("Hello World! %d\n", y);
return 0;
}

options.d: Hello World! followed by a junk value

questions.question:
What will happen if the following C code is executed?

int main()
{
int main = 3;
printf("%d", main);
return 0;
}

options.a: It will cause a compile-time error
options.b: It will cause a run-time error
options.c: It will run without any error and prints 3

questions.question:
What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 int i = 5;
printf("%d", i++ + i-- - ++i);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 int x = 4, y = 2;
x <<= y;
printf("%d", x);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 int x = 5, y = 3;
printf("%d", x & y);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 int x = 5, y = 3;
printf("%d", x | y);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 int x = 5, y = 3;
printf("%d", x ^ y);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 int x = 5;
printf("%d", ~x);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 int arr[] = {1, 2, 3};
printf("%d", arr[5]);
}

What will be the output of the following C code?

int main()
{
int a[5] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int i;
for (i = 0; i < 5; i++)
  if ((char)a[i] == '5')
    printf("%d\n", a[i]);
  else
    printf("FAIL\n");
}

options.a: The compiler will flag an error
options.b: The program will compile and print the output 5
options.c: The program will compile and print the ASCII value of 5
options.d: The program will compile and print FAIL for 5 times

questions.question:
What will be the output of the following C code?

int main()
{
signed char chr;
chr = 128;
printf("%d\n", chr);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 char str[] = "Hello";
printf("%c", str[5]);
}

What will be the output of the following C code?

int main()
{
char c;
int i = 0;
FILE *file;
file = fopen("test.txt", "w+");
fprintf(file, "%c", 'a');
fprintf(file, "%c", -1);
fprintf(file, "%c", 'b');
fclose(file);
file = fopen("test.txt", "r");
while ((c = fgetc(file)) != -1)
	printf("%c", c);
return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following C code?

int main()
{
float f1 = 0.1;
if (f1 == 0.1)
	printf("equal\n");
else
	printf("not equal\n");
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 char str[] = "Hello";
printf("%s", str + 2);
}

What will be the output of the following C code on a 32-bit machine?

int main()
{
int x = 10000;
double y = 56;
int *p = &x;
double *q = &y;
printf("p and q are %d and %d", sizeof(p), sizeof(q));
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
 char *ptr = "Hello";
printf("%s", ptr++);
}

What will be the output of the following C code on a 64-bit machine?

union Sti
{
int nu;
char m;
};
int main()
{
union Sti s;
printf("%d", sizeof(s));
return 0;
}
